article_title: Developments At The NAIC Spring Meeting: Part 3
article_text:
Developments At The NAIC Spring Meeting: Part 3

Law360, New York (May 2, 2016, 10:48 AM ET) -- This is the final part of a three part series highlighting some of the developments from the National Association of Insurance Commissioners' spring meeting that are of particular interest to the insurance industry. In this part, we will discuss long-term care and health insurers, receivership and insolvency, the financial stability task force and valuations of the securities task force.



Long-Term Care and Health Insurance



The Health Insurance and Managed Care (B) Committee adopted the charge of the Long-Term Care Innovation (B) Subgroup to examine the future...

To view the full article, register now.

article_metadata.description: In the last part of a three-part series highlighting some of the developments from the National Association of Insurance Commissioners' spring meeting, attorneys at Debevoise and Plimpton LLP discuss long-term care and health insurers, receivership and insolvency, the financial stability task force and valuations of the securities task force.
